trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon an X.509 certificate.
To get the details of the X.509 certificate, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate.

This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate"></xref> property.
certificate is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate and unique identifier.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate"></xref> property.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Id"></xref> property.
certificate is `null`.
-or-
id is null.
Gets a value indicating whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier.
The key identifier for an X.509 certificate can be expressed using many different key identifier clauses.

These key identifier clauses are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> classes.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
`true` when T is of type , , , or ; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the X.509 certificate associated with the security token.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property to get the details about the X.509 certificate associated with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token.
For instance, the thumbprint of the X.509 certificate can be accessed using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.Thumbprint%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
Creates the specified key identifier clause.

The return value for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method is one of the key identifier clause types that an X.509 certificate key identifier can be expressed in.

The possible return types are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> classes.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that is a key identifier clause for the security token.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
Call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken>.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> in an unusable state.

After calling the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> was occupying.
Always call <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Returns a value indicating whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.MatchesKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method matches criteria in the X.509 certificate in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property based on the type of the `keyIdentifierClause` parameter.
The following table details what is matched.
Key identifier clause type
What is matched

The value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.IssuerName%2A> property and the issuer serial number returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetSerialNumber%2A> method.
The data returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetRawCertData%2A> method.
The subject key identifier extension in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.Extensions%2A> property is matched.
The thumbprint that is returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetCertHash%2A> method.
`true` if skiClause is one of the , , , or types and the key identifier clauses match; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property to set the cryptographic keys for this security token to protect a SOAP message.
The keys can be used, among other things, to digitally sign or encrypt SOAP messages.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Throws an exception if the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ThrowIfDisposed"></xref> method has been called for this instance.
the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ThrowIfDisposed"></xref> method has been called for this instance.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and is the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.NotBefore%2A> property of the X.509 certificate specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and is the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.NotAfter%2A> property of the X.509 certificate specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
